Present Address: ALAMEDA SASK
Pioneer Address: ALAMEDA SASK
Year you came to Saskatchewan: 1893

(Throughout the questionnaire, "Saskatchewan" means the area which is now Saskatchewan.)

PLEASE NOTE

This questionnaire is intended for persons who came to Saskatchewan before 1914, and most of the questions are about that early period, although in a few questions information for later years is asked for.

If you cannot answer a question, leave the space blank. We realize that not one person will not be able to answer all questions, so answer those that apply to your experience and that you can remember, and leave the others.

Use extra sheets of paper if there is not enough space on the questionnaire.

Your co-operation in answering this questionnaire will be very much appreciated, and all questionnaires are preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives as part of the permanent record of our province.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
NEIGHBORLY VISITING, PARTIES, ETC.

1. In the first few years, how many houses were near enough to you for visiting back and forth? How many of these were bachelor's homes? about half

2. How often did you usually visit neighbors? about weekly

3. Did you usually visit on a Sunday, or other days? Sometimes Sunday

4. Were you often invited to other homes, or was most visiting done without an invitation? Mostly invited invitations

What time of the day did you go, in the morning and spend the day, or in the afternoon, etc.? mostly afternoon

What about meals? Did you stay when not invited beforehand?

How was the invitation to a meal worded when people had been unexpectedly? (that is, was the term to "take potluck" used, or was some other expression common?) Afternoon Visits Usually Invited to Stay for Supper

If no meal, what other refreshment might be offered to visitors who had dropped in? Lunch

5. Did the whole family go, or did someone stay home to "look after the place"? Generally, but sometimes

6. Did you ever have "bees" when groups of neighbors came together to put up a building, make quilts, or other such activity? Yes

Tell what you remember about such gatherings, giving dates if possible, telling what the "bees" were for, and how often they occurred.

Head "bee," to get house put off

7. In the earliest years that you were here, were there many parties, whilst drives or dances in homes? Describe. Yes, quite a number of

Were these more frequent in later years? Give dates.

Did you follow any kind of informal schedule, such as going by turn from one house to another at definite times—every two weeks, once a month, etc.? Nothing definite.

Made use of school at South Okanagan school

Riding clubs or schools

Square - waltz - schottische - polka
